net.java.jddac.jmdi.comm
Class CoderBuffer

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.jmdi.comm.CoderBuffer

public class CoderBuffer
extends java.lang.Object

A buffer object to hold all data and properties associated with a specific CoderInterface encode or decode operation.

See Also:
CoderInterface

adjustLength

public void adjustLength(int headerSize,
                         int trailerSize)
Increases the header and trailer size.

Parameters:
headerSize - - amount to increase header.
trailerSize - - amount to decrease trailer.

setProperties

Sets this CoderBuffer properties

Parameters:

getByteBuffer

public byte[] getByteBuffer()
Gets the entire byte[] buffer.

Returns:
- byte[] buffer.

allocateByteBuffer

public void allocateByteBuffer()
Given the current buffer lengths, allocate an empty buffer. This function is usually called after startEncode() has been called on a Coder and before encode to prepare the buffer for encoding. It has no other side affects other than setting the internal byteBuffer storage.

setByteBuffer

public void setByteBuffer(byte[] bs)
Sets the byte[] buffer. The bufferStart is set to 0 and the bufferLength to the byte[] length.

Parameters:
bs - - byte[] buffer.

getBufferLength

public int getBufferLength()
Gets the length of the active region of the buffer.

Returns:
active length.

Returns:
the start of the active region of the buffer.

setBufferLength

public void setBufferLength(int i)
Sets the length of the active region of the buffer.

Parameters:
i - - length

setBufferStart

public void setBufferStart(int i)
Sets the start of the active region of the buffer.

Parameters:
i - - start

getMaxLength

public int getMaxLength()
Gets the estimated maximum length of the result.

Returns:
computed maximum length.

setMaxLength

public void setMaxLength(int maxLength)
Sets the estimated maximum length of the result.

Clears all data and properties from this CoderBuffer.
